To use shortlinks, go to any already pub: To use shortlinks, go to any already published post (or publish something new!). A “Get Shortlink” button will be visible under the Post title. When you click it, a dialog box will appear with the shortlink and you can copy and paste to Twitter, Facebook or wherever your heart desires.
There are many plugins and services that: There are many plugins and services that provide statistics, but data can be overwhelming. Site Stats makes the most popular metrics easy to understand through a clear and attractive interface.
You can <a href=\"%s\">view your stats d: You can view your stats dashboard here.
Publicize allows you to connect your blo: Publicize allows you to connect your blog to popular social networking sites and automatically share new posts with your friends.	 You can make a connection for just yourself or for all users on your blog.
Publicize allows you to share your posts: Publicize allows you to share your posts on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Google+, Path, and Linkedin.
Keep up with the latest happenings on al: Keep up with the latest happenings on all your WordPress sites and interact with other WordPress.com users.
You can view your notifications in the T: You can view your notifications in the Toolbar and on WordPress.com.
%s is a powerful markup language for wri: %s is a powerful markup language for writing complex mathematical equations, formulas, etc.
Jetpack combines the power of %s and the: Jetpack combines the power of %s and the simplicity of WordPress to give you the ultimate in math blogging platforms.
Use <code>$latex your latex code here$</: Use $latex your latex code here$ or [latex]your latex code here[/latex] to include %s in your posts and comments. There are all sorts of options available.
Share your posts with Twitter, Facebook,: Share your posts with Twitter, Facebook, and a host of other services. You can configure services to appear as icons, text, or both. Some services have additional options to display smart buttons, such as Twitter, which will update the number of times the post has been shared.
The following services are included: Twi: The following services are included: Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, PressThis, Digg, LinkedIn, Google +1, Print, and Email.
The following services are included: Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, Digg, LinkedIn, Google +1, Print, and Email.
To configure your sharing settings, go t: To configure your sharing settings, go to the Settings → Sharing menu.
Drag and drop sharing services into the: Drag and drop sharing services into the enabled section to have them show up on your site, and drag them into the hidden section to have them hidden behind a button.
Full details can be found on the <a href: Full details can be found on the Sharing support page. This video also gives a swish run-down of how to use the Sharing feature. Watch it in HD for extra snazz!
The <a href='%s' target='_blank'>After&n: The After the Deadline Proofreading service improves your writing by using artificial intelligence to find your errors and offer smart suggestions.
After the Deadline provides a number of: After the Deadline provides a number of customization options, which you can edit in your profile.
<strong>The Twitter Widget</strong> show: The Twitter Widget shows your latest tweets within a sidebar on your theme.
<strong>The Facebook Like Box Widget</st: The Facebook Like Box Widget shows your Facebook Like Box within a sidebar on your theme.
<strong>The Image Widget</strong> lets y: The Image Widget lets you easily add images to a sidebar on your theme.
<strong>The Gravatar Widget</strong> all: The Gravatar Widget allows you to pull in your Gravatar image along with some of your Gravatar profile data.
<strong>The Gallery Widget</strong> prov: The Gallery Widget provides you with a simple way to display a photo gallery or slideshow in your blog’s sidebar. Requires the Tiled Gallery module.
<strong>The Display WordPress Posts Widg: The Display WordPress Posts Widget lets you display up to ten recent posts from another WordPress.com blog, or a self-hosted WordPress site with Jetpack enabled.
<strong>The Social Media Icons Widget</s: The Social Media Icons Widget lets you add icons for the most popular social networks to your sidebar or other widget area.
<strong>The Upcoming Events Widget</stro: The Upcoming Events Widget allows you to use an iCalendar link to display a list of events on your site.
Each of these widgets has a number of cu: Each of these widgets has a number of customization options.
To use the widgets, go to Appearance &#8: To use the widgets, go to Appearance → Widgets. Drag them into one of your sidebars and configure away.
Easily allow any visitor to subscribe to: Easily allow any visitor to subscribe to all of your posts via email through a widget in your blog’s sidebar.  Every time you publish a post, WordPress.com will send a notification to all your subscribers.
When leaving comments, your visitors can: When leaving comments, your visitors can also subscribe to a post’s comments to keep up with the conversation.
To use the Subscriptions widget, go to A: To use the Subscriptions widget, go to Appearance → Widgets. Drag the widget labeled “Blog Subscriptions (Jetpack)” into one of your sidebars and configure away.
You can also make changes to your Subscr: You can also make changes to your Subscription settings at the bottom of the Discussion Settings page.
To customize the emails sent from your b: To customize the emails sent from your blog to your followers, check the settings at the bottom of the Reading Settings page.
Jetpack will automatically take the grea: Jetpack will automatically take the great published content from your blog or website and share it instantly with third party services like search engines, increasing your reach and traffic.
Protect is a cloud-powered brute force a:
Protect is a cloud-powered brute force attack prevention tool. We leverage the millions of WordPress sites to identify and block malicious IPs.

Protect tracks failed login attempts across all Jetpack-connected sites using the Protect module.  If any single IP has too many failed attempts in a short period of time, they are blocked from logging in to any site with this plugin installed.

Protect is derived from BruteProtect, and will disable BruteProtect on your site if it is currently enabled.
Jetpack will allow you to authorize appl: Jetpack will allow you to authorize applications and services to securely connect to your blog and allow them to use your content in new ways and offer you new functionality.
Developers can use WordPress.com's <a hr: Developers can use WordPress.com's OAuth2 authentication system and WordPress.com REST API to manage and access your site's content.
A contact form is a great way to offer y: A contact form is a great way to offer your readers the ability to get in touch, without giving out your personal email address.
Each contact form can easily be customiz: Each contact form can easily be customized to fit your needs. When a user submits your contact form, the feedback will be filtered through Akismet (if it is active on your site) to make sure it’s not spam. Any legitimate feedback will then be emailed to you, and added to your feedback management area.
Comments enables your visitors to use th: Comments enables your visitors to use their WordPress.com, Twitter, or Facebook accounts when commenting on your site.
Jetpack tries to match your site's color: Jetpack tries to match your site's color scheme automatically, but you can make manual adjustments at the bottom of the Discussion Settings page.
With Carousel active, any standard WordP: With Carousel active, any standard WordPress galleries you have embedded in posts or pages will launch a gorgeous full-screen photo browsing experience with comments and EXIF metadata.
The Custom CSS editor gives you the abil: The Custom CSS editor gives you the ability to add to or replace your theme's CSS, all while supplying syntax coloring, auto-indentation, and immediate feedback on the validity of the CSS you're writing.
To use the CSS editor, go to Appearance: To use the CSS editor, go to Appearance → Edit CSS.
There's a good chance that visitors to y: There's a good chance that visitors to your site will be using a smartphone, and it's important to provide them with a great reading experience while on the small screen.
Jetpack's mobile theme is optimized for: Jetpack's mobile theme is optimized for small screens. It uses the header image, background, and widgets from your current theme for a great custom look. Post format support is included, so your photos and galleries will look fantastic on a smartphone.
Visitors on iPhone, Android, Windows Pho: Visitors on iPhone, Android, Windows Phone, and other mobile devices will automatically see the mobile theme, with the option to view the full site. You can enable or disable the mobile theme by clicking the "Activate" or "Deactive" button above.
If you are a theme author, you can learn: If you are a theme author, you can learn about adding support for Infinite Scroll at %1$s.
When you write great content, all you re: When you write great content, all you really want is people to find it, right?
With the Infinite Scroll module and a su: With the Infinite Scroll module and a supported theme, that's exactly what happens. Instead of the old way of navigating down a page by scrolling and then clicking a link to get to the next page, waiting for a page refresh—the document model of the web—infinite scrolling pulls the next set of posts automatically into view when the reader approaches the bottom of the page, more like an application.
At this time, your theme, %s, doesn't su: At this time, your theme, %s, doesn't support Infinite Scroll. Unlike other Jetpack modules, Infinite Scroll needs information from your theme to function properly.
Until your theme supports Infinite Scrol: Until your theme supports Infinite Scroll, you won't be able to activate this module.
There is an update available for your th: There is an update available for your theme. You may wish to check if this update adds Infinite Scroll support by visiting the WordPress Updates page.
Post by Email is a way of publishing pos: Post by Email is a way of publishing posts on your blog by email. Any email client can be used to send the email, allowing you to publish quickly and easily from devices such as cell phones.
Manage your Post By Email address from y: Manage your Post By Email address from your profile settings.
More information on sending emails, atta: More information on sending emails, attachments, and customizing your posts.
Give your site a boost by loading images: Give your site a boost by loading images in posts from the WordPress.com content delivery network. We cache your images and serve them from our super-fast network, reducing the burden on your Web host with the click of a button.
Create elegant magazine-style mosaic lay: Create elegant magazine-style mosaic layouts for your photos without having to use an external graphic editor.
When adding a gallery to your post, you: When adding a gallery to your post, you now have the option to select a layout style for your images. We've added support for Rectangular, Square, and Circular galleries. By default, galleries will continue to display using the standard thumbnail grid layout. To make the rectangular layout the default for all of your site's galleries, head over to Settings → Media and check the box next to "Display all your gallery pictures in a cool mosaic."
Note: Images in tiled galleries require: Note: Images in tiled galleries require extra-special processing, so they will be served from WordPress.com's CDN even if the Photon module is disabled.
Likes allow your readers to show their a: Likes allow your readers to show their appreciation for your posts and other published content using their WordPress.com accounts. Your readers will then be able to review their liked posts from WordPress.com.
Displayed below your posts will be how m: Displayed below your posts will be how many people have liked your posts and the Gravatars of those who have liked them.
You can turn Likes on by following these: You can turn Likes on by following these steps:
Make sure the module is activated by cli: Make sure the module is activated by clicking on "Activate" at the bottom of this page.
Go to Settings > Sharing in your Dashboa: Go to Settings > Sharing in your Dashboard.
Ensure that \"WordPress.com Likes are…\": Ensure that "WordPress.com Likes are…" is set to "On for all posts"
Search once, get results from everything: Search once, get results from everything! Currently supports searching posts, pages, comments, media, and plugins.
Omnisearch plays nice with other plugins: Omnisearch plays nice with other plugins by letting other providers offer results as well.
Control which pages your widgets appear: Control which pages your widgets appear on with Widget Visibility.
To control visibility, expand the widget: To control visibility, expand the widget and click the Visibility button next to the Save button, and then, choose a set of visibility options.
For example, if you wanted the Archives: For example, if you wanted the Archives widget to only appear on category archives and error pages, choose "Show" from the first dropdown and then add two rules: "Page is 404 Error Page" and "Category is All Category Pages."
You can also hide widgets based on the c: You can also hide widgets based on the current page. For example, if you don't want the Archives widget to appear on search results pages, choose "Hide" and "Page is Search results."
With the VideoPress module you can easil: With the VideoPress module you can easily upload videos to your WordPress site and embed them in your posts and pages. This module requires a WordPress.com account with an active VideoPress subscription. Once you have purchased a VideoPress subscription, click here to configure VideoPress.
With Single Sign On, your users will be: With Single Sign On, your users will be able to log in to or register for your WordPress site with the same credentials they use on WordPress.com.  It's safe and secure.
Once enabled, a "Log in with WordPress.com" option will be added to your existing log in form.
Nobody likes downtime, and that's why Je: Nobody likes downtime, and that's why Jetpack Monitor is on the job, keeping tabs on your site by checking it every five minutes. As soon as any downtime is detected, you will receive an email notification alerting you to the issue. That way you can act quickly, to get your site back online again!
We’ll also let you know as soon as your: We’ll also let you know as soon as your site is up and running, so you can keep an eye on total downtime.
\"Related Posts\" shows additional relev: "Related Posts" shows additional relevant links from your site under your posts. If the feature is enabled, links appear underneath your Sharing Buttons and WordPress.com Likes (if you’ve turned these on).
More information on using Related Posts.
This feature uses the WordPress.com infr: This feature uses the WordPress.com infrastructure and requires that your public content be mirrored there. If you see intermittent issues only affecting certain posts, request a reindex of your posts.
Markdown lets you compose posts and comm: Markdown lets you compose posts and comments with links, lists, and other styles using regular characters and punctuation marks. Markdown is used by writers and bloggers who want a quick and easy way to write rich text, without having to take their hands off the keyboard, and without learning a lot of complicated codes and shortcuts.
Use these tools to verify that you own/c: Use these tools to verify that you own/control your website with other external services like Google, Bing and Pinterest.
Verifying your site allows you to access: Verifying your site allows you to access advanced features on these other services (e.g. Webmaster tools, or getting a verified badge). We'll just add an invisible %s tag to the source code of your homepage.
To enable a custom content type, head ov: To enable a custom content type, head over to Settings → Writing → Your Custom Content Types and activate either "Portfolio Projects” or “Testimonials” by checking the corresponding checkbox. You can now add projects and testimonials under the new "Portfolio” and “Testimonials” menu items in your sidebar.
Site Icon lets you create an icon for yo: Site Icon lets you create an icon for your site. This icon will be used as favicon, mobile icon, and Tile on Windows 8 computers.
To add a new icon to your site, head ove: To add a new icon to your site, head over to Settings → General → Site Icon, and upload an icon.

Enabling Manage allows you to update you: Enabling Manage allows you to update your self-hosted WordPress sites along with any WordPress.com sites you have, all in one simple dashboard.

It may be caused by one of these issues,: It may be caused by one of these issues, which you can diagnose yourself:
Find out by disabling all plugins except: Find out by disabling all plugins except Jetpack. If the problem persists, it's not a plugin issue. If the problem is solved, turn your plugins on one by one until the problem pops up again – there's the culprit! Let us know, and we'll try to help.

Load your <a href=\"%s\">XMLRPC file</a>: Load your XMLRPC file. It should say “XML-RPC server accepts POST requests only.” on a line by itself.
If it's not by itself, a theme or plugin: If it's not by itself, a theme or plugin is displaying extra characters. Try steps 2 and 3.
If you get a 404 message, contact your w: If you get a 404 message, contact your web host. Their security may block XMLRPC.
If none of these help you find a solutio: If none of these help you find a solution, click here to contact Jetpack support. Tell us as much as you can about the issue and what steps you've tried to resolve it, and one of our Happiness Engineers will be in touch to help.
